website_summaries.verdict: A 13-piece tap and drill set that delivers sharp, fast execution time and time again.
pros: High-speed steel construction ensures the set will maintain its strength over time
Proven to perform on copper, brass, aluminum, sheet metal and plastic
Includes a 1/4" hex shank that features a tapered end to prevent over-tapping
Sold with a quick-change adapter for instant adjustments
Molded plastic case is both lightweight and versatile
cons: Less durable than many comparable sets
Bits tend to wear down quickly

customer_reviews.title: Can't even tap aluminum!
customer_reviews.text: Broke while tapping a 3/4" thick piece of aluminum with the biggest tap in the set (1/4-20). I was using cutting oil and doing the tapping part by hand. Thought this tool was a good idea - but actually just a waste of money. Oh, and the broken piece needs to be drilled out of the part I was making. Now it's worth negative dollars.

customer_reviews.title: Use an impact driver not a drill
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried from all the reviews saying they break easily. But I didn't have any trouble. Obviously, these aren't intended to be used to drill and tap a 1inch plate there meant for 1/4 inch or less thick plate or sheet metal. I had to drill out some bolts that sheared off in nuts welded to sheet metal and these worked great. You still need to drill a pilot hole that's slightly smaller than the drill and tap but after that, they worked great adding threads back to the holes. Using a wireless impact driver was the way to go as well. Less chance of breaking a tap.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, stay away!
customer_reviews.text: These are very low grade. Gets dull quick and ultimately broke on me. I will NOT buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: I Buy Stuff

customer_reviews.title: be careful, they will break.
customer_reviews.text: Go slow, be careful. They will snap with the slightest bit of over-torque, or if they get stuck in the material. I was drilling aluminum with the small 6/32 bit, and snap. The idea of the drill bit/tap in one is great, but the material is not great. I would pay more for a higher quality set otherwise you'll be waiting for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: lesogorp

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: It looked like a very nice set, at about half the price of Milwaukee's all in one drill and taps. I thought I would try them and see if they held up. I used two different bits 10/32 and 10/24, pre-drilled 1/8" holes and used tap oil on both. In the second try it broke, and the second one broke in just a couple tries also. I pulled out the Milwaukee brand and used the same process without any issues. Same drill, same speed, same oil, same pre-drilled hole. The Milwaukee brand was able to drill thru with no issues. So, I assume it is cheap steel or poor machining, but not worth it at even half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Moomba2442

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: bit broke in half while i was drilling slow and on 1 speed
customer_reviews.author: joshua alicea

customer_reviews.title: Better price, plus it's both metric and standard. Integrated drill and tap on one pass.
customer_reviews.text: I needed metric and standard drill tap. These sell for much cheaper the big Orange and Blue plus you don't have to buy two separate tap kits. The finished taps fit my screws perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: bdmeyer

customer_reviews.title: and I've always been very happy with the quality of them
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Greenlee Drill and Tap sets for years, and I've always been very happy with the quality of them, but this set is just as sturdy. In addition to that, this set includes metric bits and it sells for less than Greenlee's SAE only set.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T. McCagh

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy If you’re a metal fabricator.
customer_reviews.text: I had done a lot of reading and watched the reviews on how to use these drill taps. I pre drilled a smaller hole in the material, used cutting oil, and slowed the speed down as suggested. It was 16th inch mild steel I was attempting to thread and sure enough... 1st time the 1/4-20 drill tap snapped! I sent it back. I just don’t think these are engineered for metal thread cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk, only good thing is when they break a simple punch will break them through the metal
customer_reviews.author: Jason E Childers

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, but very very brittle
customer_reviews.text: I have used these successfully about 50% of the time, and only in thin aluminum. This seems like a great idea, but the material is too brittle to be reliable. 2 have broken at the tap part of the threads. The M3 bit actually snapped off when tapping 0.25" ABS plastic (even with with slow speed and backing off chips, etc). This review was prompted by the #8-32 tap breaking while tapping 3/32" steel.
customer_reviews.author: O. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Chinesium junk
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, but garbage product. Storage box latch was falling off when it arrived. Broke the third time I used the 6mm drill tap. Very poor chiesium junk. All these good ratings make me think there may be some dishonest reviews.
customer_reviews.author: ANOMIC

customer_reviews.title: Countersinks aren't big enough.
customer_reviews.text: The countersinking feature on these is only the diameter of the shank stock. In most of the provided sizes, it won't be sufficient for the screws head.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. K.

customer_reviews.title: Go slow, use slow speed when you get to tap area.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used twice, but effective for what I was doing. When using a power drill/driver, use slow speed setting. Practice on scrap first to get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: independently minded concerned citizen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: Broke 3 of them with little use. Bits dulled after little use. No large sizes.
customer_reviews.author: E. Perry

customer_reviews.title: What a concept
customer_reviews.text: Best drill bits ever. One tool that drills the hole, threads the hole and sets a counter sink. Wow! Not for every drilling requirement but when needed it is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: E W

customer_reviews.title: OMG, seriously. It was that easy
customer_reviews.text: Listen, I'm not a big fan of gimmicky, "this will solve all your problems" products... Having said that, oh my mutha dayum, these work so good. First time, out of the box, saved me so much time that if I see another larger set, I will buy it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the expense
customer_reviews.text: After drilling and trying to tap through a 3/8” aluminum with a 10-24 bit the bit broke even though I was using a tapping paste.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill and tap 1/4 thick aluminum for a case mod for my pc. Went through it like butter with some tap magic cutting fluid. The machine screws that I bought had zero issues screwing into the taps. There appears to be zero wear after about 50 drill and taps.
customer_reviews.author: J Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good product for light duty
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product. One tap broke on first use. Remaining bits worked well.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: arrived look great did what I wanted it for looks like a great addition
customer_reviews.text: arrived look great did what I wanted it for looks like a great addition
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great value and function
customer_reviews.text: Just as described, very good quality. Used it on metal and wood worked perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd a. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for electrical boxes.
customer_reviews.text: Works awesomely for threading electrical boxes after snapping a screw in one of the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Broke one but it was my fault so bought another set
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Just received and haven’t really used them yet. Got them quickly. Seem to be pretty good quality
customer_reviews.author: Firefighter

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Just don't use on thick steel. Perfect for aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyC

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Would not use this for heavy duty metals. these are for light materials.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Knock out two jobs with one tool.
customer_reviews.text: This dual use tool is great. Drill a hole and thread it at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: Light the idea, they unfortunately break after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: The 1/4 tap broke on first use when tapping aluminum. I even drilled a center hole before hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time
customer_reviews.text: First time I used one of the bits it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin J. Frankel

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems fine. I used the 6-32 drill/tap already
customer_reviews.text: Came in a timely fashion. Quality seems fine. I used the 6-32 drill/tap already, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: The set is good nicely pack in a case
customer_reviews.text: The drill-tap set works better when the hole is drilled first when used on hard steel, soft steel and aluminum it works find. one of the bit broke with me trying to drill & tap hard steel.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard

customer_reviews.title: really nice kit with both drills and
customer_reviews.text: OK .... really nice kit with both drills and taps
customer_reviews.author: David A. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Cheap....do not buy
customer_reviews.text: First attempt to use the one for 1/4 in it shattered. I used it on copper. These are junk
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after drilling, taping the third hole.
customer_reviews.text: I was drilling into an aluminum dock and the drill bit for the M4 broke off. Not sure if the others are defective.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Used the set 4 times. I now have 4 broken bits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: Very slow shipping. I wish I didn't pay for the expedite shipping. Waiting time was scheduled for 10 day. Waited 23. I used it for driling a 2mm metal, after the 3rd dril one of the bits broke.
customer_reviews.author: Kaysaff Tal

customer_reviews.title: slick, nice dont have to put out both tap and drill--its all in one
customer_reviews.text: 1/4 20 broke rt away , need like 4 of thoses in 1 pack, but like drill and tap to gether.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT M STEPHENS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Had a simple project over the holidays and these tap bits worked great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Broke one already
customer_reviews.text: Awesome idea but buts are brittle and snap too easily
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Moss

customer_reviews.title: If all the peices are are there and not broke.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda disappointed. There were two pieces broke and it never mentioned that when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don’t expect this bits will last. So I’ll be ordering these again.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to say on this item, me and my team used it and no complain
customer_reviews.author: Jun Ramos

customer_reviews.title: dont buy them
customer_reviews.text: to cheap breaks easy and they need to be drilled out
customer_reviews.author: lawrance

customer_reviews.title: but was better, great invention
customer_reviews.text: not quit what was expecting, but was better, great invention
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: easy too carrier
customer_reviews.text: compact. easy too carrier. no need to carry drill bits & taps
customer_reviews.author: kenneth madden

customer_reviews.title: Overall the drill / tap bits are an excellent value. The quality is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Overall the drill / tap bits are an excellent value. The quality is better than I expected. The case could be better but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Works great for mild steel - can't fault it for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used the M4 and M5 taps several times now on mild steel and they work great - you really can't fault them for the price. Just go slow and use cutting oil and they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron I

product_meta.title: Neiko 10059A Combination Drill & Tap Bit Set with Quick Change Adapter, 13Piece | SAE/Metric
product_meta.description: The Neiko 10059A Combination drill and tap bit set is designed to fulfill multiple steps in a one operation performance. It is designed to drill, tap and countersink through various tough materials easily. The deburring feature cleans the holes smoothly and bits countersinks threaded holes. The specialized bits can cut through aluminum, plastic, metal and much more to complete many jobs. The bits are fast and with multiple sizes available, Can ensure proper hole sizing. The ¼-inch hex shank has a tapered end to assure over tapping is prevented. These bits come with a storage case and are provided in both SAE and metric sizes engraved onto each piece for easy identification.
feature_bullets: High speed steel is designed to ensure sharp, fast execution and withholds strength and efficiency
Three in one operation provides hole drilling, tapping, and countersinking for a quick and complete job on copper, brass, aluminum, sheet metal and plastic
Convenient ¼” hex shank features a tapered end to prevent over-tapping and includes a quick-change adapter for easy size change
Heavy duty, molded plastic case is lightweight and durable for easy storage and is portable for all job environments
Set includes: 6 pc. Sae- 6-32nc, 8-32nc, 10-24nc, 10-32nc, 12-24nc, ¼-20NC; 6 pc. Metric- M3 x 0.5, M4 x 0.7, M5 x 0.8, M6 x 1.25, M10 x 1.5; 1 pc. Quick change adaptor

specifications.Included Components: Quick change adapter, Taps, Drill bits
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars279 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
